ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Atom feed vs. list of orders
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Why would you ever Accept: text/html?  An HTML front-end is easy enough to generate from any XML back-end.  I know that I can PUT or POST your custom media

Jan Algermissen wrote:
> 
> How would the user agent implementation deal with HTML? Special
> syntactic assumptions are not allowed (because of Accept: text/html)
> or would mean a hidden coupling.
> 

Why would you ever Accept: text/html?  An HTML front-end is easy enough
to generate from any XML back-end.  I know that I can PUT or POST your
custom media type to a given URI because I read it in your hypertext.

Whether the user agent can actually formulate a request using the custom
media type is another problem.  What matters is that your hypertext
provides a self-documenting API.

-Eric
